result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:15 AM Defendant Antoine Pinkney in court.  Attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter in court for Antoine Pinkney. Court Reporter: Saige Smith. 
Attorney Samuels is unavailable today's date due to being in trial in Kenosha. 
Defense is seeking another status date. Defendant make statements on the record regarding his bond. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Antoine Pinkney not in court.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels not in court. Court Reporter: Saige Smith  
Defendant and Attorney Samuels are both out ill. Attorney Samuels has contacted the court to waive his appearance this morning and to reschedule this hearing. 
State does not object to adjourning this matter. Asks that the court issues a bench warrant and bnond forfeiture but that it is stayed until the next court date. 
BTC: Bench warrant and bond forfeiture will be stayed until next court date. Matter set over.
